thread.title: Stars rested, veterans recalled to ODI squad
thread.title_full: Stars rested, veterans recalled to ODI squad

title: Stars rested, veterans recalled to ODI squad
text:
Aaron Finch recalled to the Australian ODI squad, stars rested for New Zealand series 3 minutes ago by Staff writers Source: FOX SPORTS AUSTRALIA has put key batsmen David Warner and Usman Khawaja on ice ahead of next month’s all-important Test tour of India. 
The star duo will not feature in the one-day series in New Zealand, with Cricket Australia opting for preparation in India over the three-game series. 
That has given veteran Aaron Finch a reprieve, with the dumped batsman called on to prop up the top order along with Shaun Marsh. 
Fast-bowling duo Mitchell Starc and Josh Hazlewood have both been named, after each was rested for one match during the triumphant ODI series with Pakistan which wraps up with game five on Australia Day. 
While Warner has simply been rested, Khawaja will fly to Dubai early for a training camp to acclimatise to subcontinental conditions. 
“With Usman heading to Dubai in the first group of players this provides Shaun with a chance to get back into international cricket following his injury earlier in the summer,” said interim national selector Trevor Hohns. Warner's outfield speccy 0:44 
Warner will be in the second group to travel to the UAE, having earned a break following his latest SCG masterclass in Sunday’s series-clinching victory over Pakistan. 
“David has had a very big summer and will benefit from a break in cricket, both mentally and physically. He will travel to Dubai in the second group of departures to coincide with those players arriving from the one-day series in New Zealand. 
“This gives Aaron an opportunity to return to the side. His form in the Big Bash League has been very good and he has earnt his recall.” 
In all, there are seven members of Australia’s 16-man Indian touring party selected — including skipper Steve Smith. 
Squad
